channel.title: XBox live and RROD
channel.description: If you get the Red ring of death, do you lose all you rank and score on online games? e.g halo ranking.

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:18, topic:177043”][quote author=_doyley link=topic=237865.msg2494623#msg2494623 date=1224332192]
Just get a x-clamp fix easy todo
[/quote]

You realize this thread is just about 119 months old?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:25, topic:177043”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=237865.msg2500317#msg2500317 date=1224623778]

You wouldn’t loose you’re rankings online, or achievements if you got them, but you would loose saved data, such as campaign, but keep all achievements.

You download your profile again from Xbox live - As if you never lost it.
[/quote]
But if you haven’t been online since you last accomplished something: i.e weren’t signed in on xbox live but still on your profile and got an achievement, it is lost when you recover it.[/quote]

If you don’t auto-sign into XBL you’re quite obviously a cunt.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:24, topic:177043”][quote author=Kaza link=topic=237865.msg2024375#msg2024375 date=1201825834]
You wouldn’t loose you’re rankings online, or achievements if you got them, but you would loose saved data, such as campaign, but keep all achievements.
[/quote]

You download your profile again from Xbox live - As if you never lost it.[/quote]
But if you haven’t been online since you last accomplished something: i.e weren’t signed in on xbox live but still on your profile and got an achievement, it is lost when you recover it.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Kaza:

You wouldn’t loose you’re rankings online, or achievements if you got them, but you would loose saved data, such as campaign, but keep all achievements.

You download your profile again from Xbox live - As if you never lost it.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:21, topic:177043”]Well yeah, having just bought a new xbox 360 it is much quieter and seems just to run much better than my older 360s. So it seems these new ‘falcon chips’ are actually better.[/quote]Yeah, they really are. Also, to further my post, there are SOME jasper chip 360s which run even cooler and lower the failure rate by another 5%. They are really rare to find, whereas the falcons aren’t. The store near me only has 3 jaspers and like 50+ falcons, although they’re only arcade(256mb hdd/ms) jaspers and no 60gb pro jaspers so when I buy a new 360 I’ll have to buy an Xbox 360 60gb pro with the falcon chip.

[quote=“RXVL, post:22, topic:177043”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=237865.msg2500104#msg2500104 date=1224618307]
Well yeah, having just bought a new xbox 360 it is much quieter and seems just to run much better than my older 360s. So it seems these new ‘falcon chips’ are actually better.
[/quote]

And cheaper.[/quote]Yeah, that too.

Also: I can go into more detail as to why the 360s had the rrod in the first place, and how MS fixed them etc etc if you want.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Baros Rocks, post:7, topic:177043”]Helps cool the 360 down I think.[/quote]Nope, it overheats and makes it so hot so the motherboard will reset and it will work for like 3 days maximum. Nowadays people shouldn’t be concerned about the rrod because the new falcon chip 360s that are in stock in pretty much every store have a 23% less chance of overheating, and with the benq/liteon drives they don’t scratch discs and they run a lot quieter and cooler. And if anyone asks me, yes, I realize that this topic is old, I just wanted to give out this information.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Put some cork under the motherboard (where the ram chips are).
You will never get the RROD again.

Once, when I was fucking around with my old xbox (first version), I got the RROD.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:12, topic:177043”][quote author=teh spede link=topic=237865.msg2023193#msg2023193 date=1201743849]
Oh lol. But why would you want to cover them up still?
[/quote]

Thug-life was joking. Towels are not going to cool your system as far as I know.
edit: http://www.engadget.com/2007/01/15/towel-trick-provides-temporary-fix-to-xbox-360s-red-ring-of-d/

My friend’s xbox360 screwed up, so he sent it back to Microsoft. Microsoft sent him back 2 of them, on seperate dates.[/quote]
yeah jme i got 4 harddrives woohoo got 1 from game, one from the original console and 2 from xbox hq.

Ontopic : It doesn’t matter since the information is likely stored on servers and such,and not on your harddrive.

item.title: XBox live and RROD
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

no frell your profile is stored on the servers, if you get it send off for a new hard drive or the way to fix it at home is turn it on lye it on its side and put 2-3 towels on it and leave for 2 hours+ then come back and try it. or if you get a new hard drive just recover your profile

Read full topic
